article.title: Scientific Systems to Integrate Advanced Navigation Into Weapon Systems
article.text: Scientific Systems Co. Inc., Woburn, Massachusetts, has been awarded a $6,600,242 firm-fixed-price Small Business Innovation Research III contract for advanced navigation common capability (ANCC). Contractor will expand upon ANCC previous work by generalizing the process of integrating the technology into weapon systems. Work will be performed at Woburn, Massachusetts, and is expected to be complete by September 14, 2017. This award is the result of a sole-source acquisition. Fiscal 2015 research and development funds in the amount of $6,600,242 are being obligated at the time of award. The Air Force Lifecycle Management Center, Eglin Air Force Base, Florida, is the contracting activity (FA8656-15-C-0124).
